meanings.definition: A reddish-brown metal that is a chemical element with the symbol Cu.
meanings.sent1: The penny is made of copper.
meanings.sent2: The copper wire conducts electricity well.
meanings.sent3: The copper pot blushed when it was heated.
meanings.sent4: Her hair shone like copper in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The old statue had turned green from the copper oxidation.

meanings.definition: A coin of a specified value made of copper.
meanings.sent1: He found a copper in the street.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepted coppers.
meanings.sent3: The copper rolled away and hid under the couch.
meanings.sent4: His pockets jingled with coppers as he walked.
meanings.sent5: She saved every copper she earned in a jar.

meanings.definition: A reddish-brown color resembling that of copper.
meanings.sent1: The autumn leaves turned a copper hue.
meanings.sent2: Her hair had a beautiful copper shine.
meanings.sent3: The artist mixed red and brown to create a copper color.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in shades of copper.
meanings.sent5: The old car had a faded copper paint job.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with a layer of copper.
meanings.sent1: He decided to copper the entire statue for preservation.
meanings.sent2: The chef likes to copper his pots for better heat distribution.
meanings.sent3: She tried to copper her jewelry for a unique look.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to copper the frame of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The workers will copper the roof to prevent rusting.
